description: Sweet couscous doused with olive oil before being steamed and then mixed with cold butter (or milk) and sugar. It's usually decorated with a variety of nuts, dates, and other fruits before serving. Masfouf is traditionally prepared for suhur during the holy month of Ramadan.

A chickpea soup made with dried chickpeas served in a thin, garlic- and cumin-flavored broth. Served over pieces of stale crusty bread, a poached egg and a host of other ingredients like tuna, capers, harissa, olive oil, and lime juice. Itâ€™s commonly eaten for lunch or dinner, especially during colder weather to help the body stay warm.

A saffron-flavoured rice cooked with meats, seafood, and vegetables. Originating in the rice-growing areas on Spain's Mediterranean coast, the dish is especially associated with the region of Valencia
An uncooked mixture of tomatoes, garlic, olive oil, water, vinegar, onions, cucumbers, and green peppers, thickened with bread crumbs
